creator: vishal@thesunflowerlab.com
text:
I am using JMeter script to run 100+ threads on HTTP environment and works like charm. As soon as I move test script to point identical HTTPS environment, it starts invalidating sessions just after 3+ simultaneous threads. 

Here is the config.
- Cookie Manager: clearing cookie on each iteration.
- Cookie Manger: default policy (Have tried all the combination.)
- Protocol: https, Port: 443
- Reading dynamic login information from CSV config data.

Apart from HTTP vs HTTPS there is no difference at all between both the environments.

(If I have recorded script from HTTP environment. Does that make any difference if recorded from HTTPS environment? Do I need to re-record it again from newly targeted environment?)

Hello,
Bugzilla is not a suppot forum.
Please use JMeter Users mailing list to ask your question.
After discussions on this mailing list, if discussion leads you to think it's a bug, then reopen an issue attaching a simple test plan to reproduce your issue and as many details as you can.

Regards
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
